S.FORM: mavacangʉ mʉmʉa, tumatuturua pakiaturua mʉmʉa arinani sipiamia kari aanʉaanʉ hla'alua.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的拉阿魯哇語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say \\\food\\\" in Raalua."

S.FORM: tumakahlangi u i kari pakiaturua na?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: pakiaturua, ku aku takahlangʉ, tuahlʉ i pi ngahlangahla?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ku aku a timahla, tuahlʉ i pi taisa?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: kumakita kiia naani! pi ʉlʉsa ihlaku pi ngahlangahla.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: pia ngahlangahla. pia taisa kiia vahliungu.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: umauhli kiia patʉkʉ laʉlaʉvʉ na siasamusu.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: umaria tainana cu amu, arupakakita mana taluavaʉlana.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: ihlaku ia mamaini isa Tautau, ihlaku ia pia Paa'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Tautau, and my name is Paa’ʉ.

S.FORM: ihlaku ia mamaini umaiapʉ isa Paa'ʉ ihlaku ia pia Mu'u.
S.TRANSL: I’m a student of Paa’ʉ, and my name is Mu’u.

S.FORM: kana'ana ia ahlalua ku hlahlusa, kana'ana ia pia Muakai.
S.TRANSL: He’s my brother, his name is Muakai.

S.FORM: kana'ana ia Kuatʉ. kana'ana ia tam Kuati ku.
kana'ana ia tukucu ku, ngahlaisa kana'ana ia 'Avi.
S.TRANSL: 他是我的朋友，他的名字是’Avi.。
She is a friend of mine, her name is Avari.

S.FORM: laihla usua caihli isa kana'ana mamisa.
tainini a caihli isa amau mamisa?
malimahlʉ caihli isa ama ku na mamisa.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: maru sasua ahlahlalua ku, cacihli a hlimilavaʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, ucaniika kana'ana ia tahlana Pinan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but she is a Pinan.

S.FORM: tam langica i ama u na?

S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: macahlia u i hlimihlimilavaʉ na masi kari cucumacu?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, macahlia hlakana'ana masi kari cucumacu.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: maru papiaini a ahlahlalua hlimihlimilavai u?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?
是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.
我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: murumitacu a tahliaria, tam macici a langica.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: arinani ku asarʉmʉ ku acici, tam mavacangʉ.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: uka'a lulunga langica na, kipuhlu cu a 'acangʉrahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: hlamuna mikacʉ, murumita cu a tahliaria , murumita cu a valahlʉvahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: tam mavacangʉ, tam macici a langica.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: tam masarʉmʉ a langica na, tumua kia paritatʉpʉhlʉ.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: miataisa usahlʉ cucuvanana, atʉhlʉngʉ kia ihlau mahlava saunga.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: ausi cu hliumusahli, matarʉngʉ a sala'a na.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: hliumusahlʉ i? tiarau matarʉngʉ a tihla'ahlʉ?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: umausausahlʉ vahlita na, ku aku ahlava saunga.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: tam taisa varatʉ na, paricarʉmʉ vunguku.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: tam macici a tahliaria na, sumahlilingipasʉ vunguku.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: asapu cu a ku mahlava siasuhlatʉ.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ku aku ahlava mʉmʉa, muasa ita pu'a.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: hlaa pu'a ita siasuhlatʉ a'ʉ i ia?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, tumua ku mana pu'a siasamusu.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: hlaa pu'a ita kuamaivʉvʉrʉnga a'ʉ i ia?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: asapucu cu a ku paracici cʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: asapu cu a ku mahlava cʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kʉlʉsa ita umuu ciri ku na!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: tumua ku umau kuamamahlipapu a isa ariatʉkʉrana.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: hlimahlava ku cʉrʉ arinani, kʉlʉsa ita mau umuu kumamahlipapu.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

S.FORM: hlaa muasa ita pi taʉhlʉkai a'ʉ i ia?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: hlaa muasa ita maritʉkʉ taʉhlʉkai a'ʉ i ia?

S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: a'ʉ, kani'i vʉtʉraʉ na avuri ku ihlau.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: talʉlʉvani aku umala sipasasahli a'ʉ i ia?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: maivavʉvʉtʉraʉ aku, auhlunu a Amahlʉ na tumalʉlʉvʉ ihlau umala.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Amahlʉ to carry it for you.

S.FORM: tam 'aʉrʉ a sasaruana na, cu samusu.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: cucuvanana, kuna ku pailalʉpʉngʉ naani na.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: ngasa ta'iara macu u taluvaʉlʉ umiiapʉ?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?
I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: ngasa ta'iara isa kana'ana maci taluvaʉlʉ umiiapʉ?
pakisuahlai ma i salia Vanau na?

S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai ma i salia Vanau na?
uka'a salia kana'ana, pakisuahlai ngasa ta'iara u?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tamu'uhlahlusa ihlaku ia Aruuai, maruapangʉhlʉvʉ kia.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Aruuai, please open the door.

S.FORM: Hlaa'u, ihlaku ia ʉlʉkʉ, mʉcʉkʉhlʉ aku ukikirimi ihlau pasaulaula'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: Hlaa’u, I’m ʉlʉkʉ, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: a'ʉ, tamuucu aku atʉatʉhlʉngʉ ihlau, pasakulai muacʉkʉhlʉa arupakakari.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: tuapuru kia, miiama kia hlitavʉra rahlʉngʉ na.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: tam mavacangʉ miima hlitavʉramu rahlʉngʉ na.
muara mau umana ita masukiu'u na!
a'ʉ, kitaʉ a masukiu'u kani'i na tam mavacangʉ.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: pahlalipingi cu a ina'a na kuaruvaruvana, pasakulai mʉcʉkʉhlʉ umuu!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: kuatumuhlu kia maatumuhlu kia, cucu'u ita i?
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: miacikiri cu aku, mungahlngahla mʉcʉkʉhlʉ mana kumita ihlau.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: ruvana cu, muasa cu aku pauili salia.
a'ʉ, maci pi pasamia ia mʉcʉkʉhlʉ mana salia ku pasaulaula'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: mavacangʉ mʉmʉa, ruavicia pakiaturua arinani cucu'u mʉmʉa musa miararuma takuliliungu hlamama.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: a'ʉ! maruamia ita kari Hla'alua makakari hlamama na.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說拉阿魯哇語。
Okay! We’re going to say Hla’alua to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: macahlia mu masi kari Hla'alua! tamuucu mavacangʉ!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說拉阿魯哇語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: mavacangʉ mʉmʉa, ruavicia pakiaturua arinani cucu'u mʉmʉa musa ʉvʉvʉcʉngʉa taku'i'iarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: mʉcʉkʉhla mʉmʉa patavʉhlʉrʉ, atʉhlʉngʉ mahlava pahlivinga aruamia.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: a'ʉ, pakiaturua, hliumala cu amu pahlivinga aruamia na.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: mavacangʉ mʉmʉa, muasa ita arinani aupaupanga kuli'i na.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: patavʉhlʉra mʉmʉa, pu'alalangʉ amu siutatungusa likihli.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: 'ahliacuvunga ia ahlaahlamʉa, 'ilikusu ia vuhlivuhlia, tarisiacʉpʉcʉpʉngʉ a kumita mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: ucani cu pakiaturua ia puaili tarucucuvungu amu.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: hlikumita ku matumuhlu vuhli'i, maaru mana matumuhlu ahlamʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: upapalu aku mana, ratunga cu a vanavanarʉ aku.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: kiʉlʉsa ita musa makahlangulu a'ʉ i ia?

S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: tam luhlua sahlumu naana, marua mu naani makahlangulu sangalʉ.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: likihli misaini a hliutungusa u mʉcʉkʉhlʉ?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: hlimutungusu a ku likihli salia kikucu mʉcʉkʉhlʉ.

S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: malilikihli a ama'a na ihlaku kiʉlʉsʉ musala.
auninia kana'ana ma kaupuapangʉ musala ariatʉkʉrana?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: hlimutungusu a kana'ana likihli umarua hluvu'u miararuma musala ariatʉkʉrana.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: aunini a tamuuahlaina musa pu'a hlatʉngʉ?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: mulilikihli a kana'ana musa pu'a hlatʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: aunini u musa sasaruana Laan-I na?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: mutungusu aku 'avangʉ musa sasaruana Laan-I na.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: aunini a kana'ana musa sasaruana Laan-I na?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: mutungusu a kana'ana saliamiapihlihli musa sasaruana Laan-I na.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: likihli misaini a hliutungusa kana'ana musa takau?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: hliutungusa kana'ana likihli umarua hluvu'u musa takau.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: mutungusu i kana'ana likihli apuhlu musa taitu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, mutungusu a kana'ana likihli apuhlu musa taitu.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: mutungusu i kana'ana likihli apuhlu musa taitu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ku, mutungusu a kana'ana salia miapihlihli musa taitu.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: maru i ma liliunga utatungusa likihlisalia?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: maru, muahlaluhlalusu ia kumakitaci kia utatungusa likihlisalia.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: ma ninau a mataingalʉ masahli aatʉ utatungusa likihli umarua hluvu'u miararuma?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: naani uka'a utatungusa na likihli umarua hluvu'u miararuma, mutatungusu sangalʉ likihli mahlisarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: atainini a rahlu a isa maci mutungusu likihlisalia miungu ariatʉkʉrana na?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: atainini a rahlu a isa miungu taiciu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: rahlu a i maci mulikihli musa Uulai na?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: atainini a rahlu a isa macu u mutungusu likihli umarua hluvu'u miararuma na miungu salia ku?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: macahlia u i mulikihli umarua sapahlʉ na?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: macahlia ku mulikihli umarua sapahlʉ na.

S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: maru i pasamia u kʉlʉpʉngʉ kumamahlipapu? hlatumua ku mahlukua ihlau takuliliungu tuahlʉ i?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, ma ku salia upapalu ihlau.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: maru i pasamia u matata? hlatumua ku pakisuahlai ihlau kisuahlahlama Hla'alua na.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於拉阿魯哇的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of Hla’alua.

S.FORM: muasa ku vuvulunga matata, uka'a ku salia.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: hlitumimahla ku macahlia u ami sitakuamia Hla'alua na, hlatumua patuturu ihlau.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對拉阿魯哇的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of La Aloua and I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: kuatumuhlu acahli ku, ucanika tuahlʉ aku umalivalʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai tuahli ku i pi'ahlingu? aunana ia cucuari matalakiahlʉ sumuhlatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai taininicu a caihli u mamisa?
masiahli cu ualu a caihli ku.
pakisuahlai usumaniu na Hla'alua i mʉmʉa?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是拉阿魯哇族人嗎?
Is your wife also a La’arruvian?

S.FORM: macahlia u i masi kari usumanʉ?
macahlia ku masi kari Hla'alua hla kari pinan.
S.TRANSL: 我會說拉阿魯哇語和卑南語。

S.FORM: tam masasangarʉ arinani takuliliungu ihlau, kisu'alivata ihlau sitakuamia palisia siuruacʉka a'ʉ i ia?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, aku ku alamuru mana rumahlaʉ karʉkʉhlʉ musa vuvulunga mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: 'ʉ'ʉraisa, hliturua u arinani ia tam mavacangʉ.

Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: ku a tapu'ai kana'ana, kana'ana ia ahlu'u.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: ma naani kumita, kukia uasaihla sasaruana!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: kukia itahlahlʉ, muamuamuarʉ musa talʉmʉlʉmʉcu milakupu.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: mutatungusa aku miapipihlihli saliana musa Pʉngʉhu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: mutatungusa aku likihli muamasahli puaili salia.

S.TRANSL: How does Paulina go to church?

S.FORM: mulikihli umaruamia sapahlʉ Paulina musa tapakia.
S.TRANSL: Piacʉ goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: mutatungusu u i likihli muamasahli musa ariatʉkʉrana?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ku, mutatungusu aku likihli kikucu musa ariatʉkʉrana.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: mulikihli umaruamia sapahli u i musa ariatʉkʉrana?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, mulikihli umaruamia sapahlʉna aku musa ariatʉkʉrana.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: mutatungusa u i likihli hluvu'u musa Takau?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: a'ʉ, mutatungusa aku likihli hluvu'u musa Takau.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: mutatungusa u likihli apuhlu ahla mutatungusu miapihlihli salia musa Taitu?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: mutatungusa aku salia miapihlihli, mutatungusa salia miapihlihli mataingalʉ maliahlʉ likihli apuhlu.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: musa tapakia mutatungusu a u likihli kikucu ahla mualikihli?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: mualikihli aku musa tapakia, mualikihli mataingalʉ talakiahlʉ mutatungusa likihli kikucu.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: masahli i i'a'ana tarʉtatʉkʉhlʉ pahlivinga aatʉ salia mu?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: kuasahli, riani ku mulikihli umaru 'urai musa i'a'ana tarʉtatʉkʉhlʉ pahlivinga.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: masahli i tai'a'ana aatʉ parana utatungusa likihli?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: kipuhlu utatungusa likihli, musasala mʉlʉngʉsʉ takʉmʉnʉ ulima utuatapusana miungu cu.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: maru ku ta'iara arinani kuaku ma salia. mungahlʉ mau ari .
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: hla maru i pasamia u matata? musa ku ukikirimi ihlau kʉlʉpʉngʉ mahlipapu.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: acahli, ma ku salia pupapalu ihlau.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai tuahlʉ ku i sumasuhlatʉ? hlatumua ku sumasuhlatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: takuliacʉ aku kumita uka'a hlimaihlʉmʉhlʉmʉ risakʉ mʉmʉa, sianata.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: kupipahlumiamia, ngasa hlatumua kiahlahlamu a u?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?
請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: hlipi'aumu aku kiariari, hla malilʉpʉngʉ cu aku ta'iara kani'i.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: pakisuahlai maruaru i mamaini u miararuma mʉmʉa?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: umupangʉ ku mana cacihli tasau hla ucani ahlamʉ, ihlaisa ia ucani pihlingi ku mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: umupangʉ ku cacihli ngiau mʉmʉa, maru kuli'i pualaʉvʉ kucu mialala.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: pakisuahlai aku ihlau ausikan palisiaisa mʉrʉcʉkana.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: kuatumuhlua acahliaku, hla ucanika tuahlʉ umalivalʉ rianʉ aliavali aku ihlau.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: maru i ngasa palisia amu vuuru mʉrʉcʉka?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: kuacahli a pititupu ahlaina vuuru mu mʉrʉcʉka.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: hla acahli i ahlaina musa mʉrʉcʉka mʉmʉa?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Hlakuta'i, uka'a cu a mapaci salia, cu pu'a.
S.TRANSL: Hlakuta’i, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: marumana ucani talangahlʉ tavava, sianata'ai pu'a!
S.TRANSL: 廚房還有一瓶，不用買吧!

S.FORM: kuiatʉhlʉngʉ ucani talangahlʉ, mungahlʉ musa pu'a usua talangahlʉ puaili.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: pu'a ku mapaci, maru amu i i'a'a?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: pu'a ku usua talangahlʉ, tumuamana pu'a ucani cavu ʉvʉraʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: ma naani a ʉvʉraʉ, marumana i misaini?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: pu'a ku mana 'asarʉ, maru amu i?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: tumua ku pu'a tapungu manitʉkʉ tikuru.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Hlakuta'i inihliangahli cu a kicuvanana? sikuatitipa u i?
S.TRANSL: Hlakuta’i你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Hlakuta’i, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?
No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: aunaniiau, maru i pasamia u ruvana, tumua i kualʉsʉ ku uumu uuru.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: kuacahli, tumua ku musa pu'a tikuru.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: mavacangi u, pakisuahlai tainini a vahlituku hlatʉngʉ kani'ina?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: ucani lʉmʉhlana hlatʉngʉna ia mapuahlʉ vahlituku ahlamʉ.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: ucani tingatinga mairangʉ ia matuluhlu vahlituku ahlamʉ.
uvura ihlaku usua lʉmʉhlana hlatʉngʉ hla ucani tingatinga mairangʉ.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Vintia asapu cu aku mahlava siasuhlatʉ, acahli u i pauhli ihlaku?
S.TRANSL: Vintia，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Vintia, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?
I don’t have one either. This is Apʉ’s.

S.FORM: hla acahli i pauhli aku mu'alivatʉ, makacani aku apuaili ihlau.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Apʉ for me.

S.FORM: tumua ku apuaili usua tʉpʉhlana suhlatʉ kani'ina.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: tumua ku mana umuhli utulu tʉpʉhlana suhlatʉ kani'ina.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: tuahlisa cu, atʉhlʉngʉ alʉ apuaili utulu ari mulavaʉ.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: ku u i umuhli cu a Vintia.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Vintia?

S.FORM: kuaku acahlia. musa ku pakisuahlai kana'ana.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Apʉ paritatʉpʉhla kani'i hliumuhli i Vintia ihlau?
S.TRANSL: Apʉ, did Vintia lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ku hlipu'a inaku uvura ihlaku kani'i.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.
Vintia’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: malicʉcʉ a paritatʉpʉhla isa, kuparaiahlʉ tapaʉ a mu.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Apʉ, hliumuhli i vahlituku Vintiana ihlau?
S.TRANSL: Apʉ, did you borrow money from Vintia?

S.FORM: maru, mairahlu ku apuaili isana arinani, asapu cu ku mahlava vahlituku.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: a'ʉ, tumalʉlʉvi aku ihlau kihlamuhlamu Vintiana.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Vintia for you.

S.FORM: tumua matisangalʉ taluvucu mairahlu umarumia takingi, 'ikarʉna ia mairahlu aruamia tiluu matiasangalʉ, takumacu aunani.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: usuanganai aunani, takʉsapu cu a ku! usuangana ku kupatiakʉhla.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: mungahlʉ aku tumututuru ihlau tumamahlʉngʉ usua ngahlana ringai.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: a'ʉ! tam mavacangʉ! aunani ia macahlia aku matiasangalʉ cu a kuli'i cucuari.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: mʉlʉngʉsʉ angatʉ cu a sʉsʉngʉ hlipatuaiiailia, musa u risakʉ umala kakamalʉ, musa mu hlipatuaiiailia.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ma patʉkʉ parangahlʉ, puaruma u risakʉna ia taratʉahlʉ cu.
S.TRANSL: 在大圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: maiatuhluhlu umala, kukia patahlivu. tam mavarʉvarʉ a kakamalʉna.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: ma kalahlapa palungu kiu'u ringai ku.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: ma ku nani patacukahlangʉ, macahlia ku maninau ringai ku.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: talahlʉ kani'ina, iku aku patʉkʉ hluhlungu pariavuvutukuhlu.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: uka'a mu talahlʉ kaiu, rianʉ uruamia iacapa mu matisangalʉ vutukuhlu.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: uka'a ku hliuruamia iacapa, tuahlʉ u i tumututuru ihlaku mungahlʉ ari?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: hla tumututuru aku ihlau tumamahlʉngʉ talahlʉ mungahlʉ ari.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: titipa cu u iacapa, kui maru vutukuhlu pakakaihli cu, pasakulai u rʉkʉcʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: cucuvana, kuatitipa cu a 'avangʉna, ma ku naani rʉkʉcʉ iacapa, musa u kaiu tumalʉlʉviaku alʉ sapuarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: rʉkʉci u vutukuhlu uamia ku naani, tumalʉlʉvʉ aku ihlau rʉkʉcʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.
太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: pasakulai mu puaili pupusua pahlumiamia cucu mʉmʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: takualimaʉ a arinani, taluavaʉlʉ a matata, kiʉlʉsʉaita murumita vahlita pasaulaula'ʉ!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: takuatuluaʉ matata, musalaitamau kʉlʉpʉngʉ kumamahlipapu matata pasaulaula'ʉ taʉhlʉkai!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: taluavaʉlana ari matata, muasalaku mʉlʉvʉ ina'a mahlukua parana tapakiana.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: pakiaturua, macarʉmʉ a civukaku, muasaku tatiahla.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: pakiaturua, tam macarʉmʉ a vunguku, taluavaʉlʉaku kʉlʉpʉngʉ kumamahlipapu.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: pakiaturua, taluavaʉlʉaku muangahlangahla takuacaniaʉ aari, muasaaku pakita maisasavusavuanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: macarʉmʉ a civukaisa kana'ana, ma tatiahla kana'ana.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: pakiaturua, macarʉmʉ a alʉmʉsaisa Taahlʉna, taluvaʉlʉ arinani.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Taahlʉna has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: ngahlaku ia Hlakuta'i savauana, maahlʉ a caihliku mamisa.
S.TRANSL: My name is Hlakuta’i savauana, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
是的，我們全家都是拉阿魯哇族人。
Yes, my whole family is Hla′alua.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: tʉkʉhlʉ, amaku ia Hla'alua, inaku ia Pakisia'a.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是拉阿魯哇族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Hla′alua, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: amau i kana'ana? taininicu a caihlisa?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: amau i kana'ana? taininicu a caihlisa?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: tʉkʉhlʉ, kana'ana ia hlamamaisa miararumahlamu, malʉhlicu a caihlisa kana'ana.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: laihla ualu a caihlisa ahlaluaku hlahlusa.
matatanini a caihlisa ahlaluau hlahlusa ihlau?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?
好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?
I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ma parana makahlangulu a kana'ana, tarisia kana'ana cucuvanana makahlangulu.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ini paninau a Na'apʉ? tarisia kana'ana cucuvanana mitahlahlʉ.
S.TRANSL: Na’apʉ在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Na’apʉ? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ma kana'ana parana taruacucuvungana, musaku makihluhluisana.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: muasaku mualualu pu'a kuamamahlipapu, cucuvanana uakikirimi ihlau.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: ukikirimamau cucu'u usumanʉ, muasaku ukikirimi pakiaturua.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.
Is Tautauna competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: aari kana'a kurarau sikuatitipana kiapuhluu i tarisia?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: aari kana'a kurarau sikuatitipana kiapuhluu i tarisia?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ngasa tarisiahlamu aari kana'a kurarau sikuatitipana?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.
我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?
你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: uka'a, musa murumita a kana'ana kicuvanana, curuvanacu iniciki puaili.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ma hlikicu langica a kana'ana, cuumau kikirimu kana'ana.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ihlaisau'iau Pali, rahluuacuu kuakitikiti, mavacangiu i?
S.TRANSL: 是Pali阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Pali. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: ma tavava a kana'ana umangʉangʉrarʉ camai, muasaku makihluhluisana.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: musa a kana'ana taturukukana matisangalʉ turukuka.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: kupa salia a tamumu hlahlusa, ma umuma, marukia ihlamu salia upapaluisana puaili.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.
這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: rahluua kuacʉkʉhlʉ, makiahluhluaku ihlamu mʉmʉa kʉlʉsʉ uumu uuru.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: sianata, miamaaku hlitavura, muasaita taraukuhla arupakakari.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.
謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: hlamuna hlipapaci a turukukana, ahlavu kuamuamuarau.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: arupapiatʉtʉrʉita matata kʉlʉpʉngʉ kumamahlipapu tuahlʉ i?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: arupapiatʉtʉrʉita maru ariatʉkʉrana tuahlʉ i? umalaita 'ahlingu.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: maci aunana ia ararata'aitamau maru tapuhlaihlia, ma hlʉngasʉaku mahlukuaisana.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: miararumahlamu kiutavahlihlana makaavacangʉ makatavahlihla. maci makatavahlihlacu ia muacʉkʉhlʉkia takuliliungu!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: maci aunana ia uapapalucu ahlavʉngʉlaia, aunana ia rahluacu angatʉ!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: maci aunana ia muacʉkʉhlʉkia maci miatungusu!
S.TRANSL: 那你貝神祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: pakisuahlai tiarau puaili arauhlusu miararuma mangusipi?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ta'iaraisaka malʉngʉngʉaku miararumaku, ahliaku'ai mʉmʉa takuaili miararumaku.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: tam macahliau turarapuru, ngahlaisa hlitumuruturu ihlau?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: ihlaisa tamuku ahlaina, ihlaisa ma miararumahlamu tam macahlia turarapuru.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: turarapuruna ia ihlaisa sitakuamiahlamu, hlatumuaku takuahlusuhlusu sitakuamiana.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: tam sa'au a kani'i mapaci hlipicu ʉvʉcʉngʉna.

S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: sianata, taia'ai ucani taluavaʉlana. mualualu paucaciri maisikici hla ʉvʉcʉngʉ, hla papuhla taamuhlu tumitiuru, acahlicu karaiuru tangurusu.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: maaru samʉsamʉmiku hla takʉcʉngʉ, rianʉ hlilimikiku takacicihli!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!
我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: tam langʉlangʉ, tuahlʉ i marimaini a marikasʉkasʉ?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: hlimini'ai! aunana ia aacaniaku tikuru malicʉcʉna.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tumuaku kani'i hlitakʉ hla kani'i tangʉtiana.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: matarungahlʉ usua hlimiaili, kani'ina hlitakacicihliku tumamahlʉngʉ, tʉtʉrʉ aruarahluaʉ.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: makiahluhluaku tukucu mʉcʉkʉhlʉ pu'a, tuahlʉ i kupulalangʉlangʉisana?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: muaramau kumikita! maaru a tikuru maaru a sarapungu.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: ucani tikuru ia utulu hlimiungu malimahlʉ, maci utulu ia ucani hlimiaili vahlitungana.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.
我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: mavacangiu, hlatumuaku pu'a tangusuhlu hla papa'a hllilapinga imuu.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: pukucuaicu a tangusuhlu, marumana ulunguku tana'ʉ, pu'au i?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: hlimini'ai! umalaku ucani cucuana muangahlangahlaku'ai tʉkʉhlʉ ari mʉcʉkʉhlʉ pu'a tangusuhlu.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: aa'ʉ, karaiauruku'ai luvucu, aunani ia malimahlʉ vahlitungana.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
